name: XVerExtensionObservationDefinition.qualifiedValue
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:ObservationDefinition.qualifiedValue compared to FHIR R4
description: R5 `ObservationDefinition.qualifiedValue` does not appear in the target and has no mapping for `ObservationDefinition`.

element.short: Set of qualified values for observation results
element.definition: A set of qualified values associated with a context and a set of conditions -  provides a range for quantitative and ordinal observations and a collection of value sets for qualitative observations.
element.comment: R5 `ObservationDefinition.qualifiedValue` does not appear in the target and has no mapping for `ObservationDefinition`.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.short: Value of extension
element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Context qualifier for the set of qualified values
element.definition: A concept defining the context for this set of qualified values.

element.short: Targetted population for the set of qualified values
element.definition: The target population this  set of qualified values applies to.
element.comment: If this element is not present then the global population is assumed.

element.short: male | female | other | unknown
element.definition: The gender this  set of qualified values applies to.

element.short: Applicable age range for the set of qualified values
element.definition: The age range this  set of qualified values applies to.
element.comment: Some analytes vary greatly over age.

element.short: Applicable gestational age range for the set of qualified values
element.definition: The gestational age this  set of qualified values applies to.

element.short: Condition associated with the set of qualified values
element.definition: Text based condition for which the the set of qualified values is valid.

element.short: reference | critical | absolute
element.definition: The category of range of values for continuous or ordinal observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.short: The range for continuous or ordinal observations
element.definition: The range of values defined for continuous or ordinal observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.short: Value set of valid coded values as part of this set of qualified values
element.definition: The set of valid coded results for qualitative observations  that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.short: Value set of normal coded values as part of this set of qualified values
element.definition: The set of normal coded results for qualitative observations  that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.short: Value set of abnormal coded values as part of this set of qualified values
element.definition: The set of abnormal coded results for qualitative observations  that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.short: Value set of critical coded values as part of this set of qualified values
element.definition: The set of critical coded results for qualitative observations  that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.short: Set of qualified values for observation results
element.definition: A set of qualified values associated with a context and a set of conditions -  provides a range for quantitative and ordinal observations and a collection of value sets for qualitative observations.
